definition[0]: to put something in the place where it is usually kept
example[0]: He put his toys away every night.
example[1]: We’re putting some money away for expenses.
definition[2]: to put someone in a prison or in a mental hospital
example[2]: If you are found guilty, the judge is going to put you away for life.
definition[3]: to eat or drink a lot
example[3]: It’s amazing the amount that child can put away.
definition[4]: to score a goal, especially after other failed attempts
example[4]: He seized the opportunity to put the ball away.
definition[5]: to defeat your opponent in a sports competition
example[5]: Two plays later, Smith scored to put the game away.
definition[6]: to save money to spend later
example[6]: He has a few thousand put away for his retirement.
